attributes.comment:
In concept, we appreciate a single source for a provider registry. A single ‘phone book’ would be great.
Nebraska migrated the Aging & Disability Resource center provider directory with 211 in 2022. This combined resources and eliminated duplication in the provider directory efforts.
The US Department of Transportation, Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration, in the early 1990s successfully implemented two efforts that may provide ideas: 1) the Commercial Driver’s License (CDL), and the commercial trucking apportionments.
Issues to address up front as this is built:
1.Assign who will manage the updates and validate changes/additions once submitted.
2.Ensure website links and emails are ping’d on a schedule to confirm validity.
3.Provide funding for the update and maintenance efforts described.
4.Determine if for-profit entities are to be listed alongside nonprofit providers.
5.Determine how ‘bad actors’ will be identified, removed/banned from the site.
a.Determine if ‘bad actors’ or providers with violations are flagged in the directory.
6.Collaborate with 211 databases across the US. They have these lists already and are doing an admirable job.
7.Collaborate with ADRCs across the US. If the ADRC is managing a provider database, outside of 211, make those connections.
8.Provide a data dictionary for the systems to talk, and staff to confirm content.
9.Offer a public search, and a provider/peer search. Needs are different.
